      • hasCards

      • hasPlayableCards

        public boolean hasPlayableCards()
        This method checks if the Player has playable cards in his hand. It is invoked by the TurnHandlerHuman to decide if we have to ask the User to play an ObjectCard or not. Note: it also checks the hasMoved variable of the Player to know which cards to look for.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • drawCard

        public ObjectCard drawCard(java.lang.String key)
                    throws CardNotPresentException
        Extract and return a card from the player's hand a card matching "key" is selected. The card is removed from the player's hand If no valid card is found, the method will throw a CardNotPresentException.
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        CardNotPresentException

      • searchForCard

        public ObjectCard searchForCard(java.lang.String key)
                         throws CardNotPresentException
        This method goes on to call the method of class hand getCardFromString(String key). It doesn't modify anything.
        Throws:
        CardNotPresentException

      • hasAttacked

        public boolean hasAttacked()

      • attackEndedSuccessfully

        public abstract void attackEndedSuccessfully()
        For the Human, this method doesn't do anything. For the Alien, this method rises the movement range from 2 cells to 3 cells.
        Specified by:
        attackEndedSuccessfully in interface PlayerActionInterface
